definitions.definition: having a hole or empty space inside

examples.text: The tree trunk was hollow inside.
Her stomach felt hollow with fear.
I felt hollow from lack of food.
The experience left her feeling hollow and empty.
I tapped the tin and it sounded hollow.

definitions.definition: making a low sound like that made by an empty object when it is hit

examples.text: I've had enough of their **hollow promises**.
She gave a slightly hollow laugh.
Their appeals for an end to the violence had a **hollow ring**.
He won something of a **hollow victory** when his opponent was forced to withdraw with a serious injury.

definitions.definition: to give the impression of not being sincere or true

examples.text: His expressions of support rang rather hollow.

definitions.definition: to give the impression of being sincere/true or not sincere/true

examples.text: It may seem a strange story but it rings true to me.
His expressions of support rang rather hollow.

wordOrigin: Old English holh ‘cave’; obscurely related to hole.
